title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish and operate managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. These plans can be operated through Department health-care facilities or other entities, following standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary may prescribe minimum health care benefits for veterans enrolled in managed health-care plans, including benefits covered under Medicare. An enrollment system may be established for veterans not covered under certain sections, and cost-sharing requirements can be set to cover additional plan benefits not paid by Medicare. The Social Security Act allows for cost-sharing requirements such as premiums, copayments, and deductibles for veterans enrolled in a health-care plan. Payments received for care provided to veterans are credited to the Department's medical appropriation. The Secretary must ensure that sufficient funds are allotted to Department facilities to provide necessary hospital care and medical services to veterans. The Social Security Act allows cost-sharing for veterans' health care. The Secretary must ensure enough funds for hospital care and medical services. Section 1710(a)(1) determines the number of veterans needing care in a fiscal year. A new item is added to the table of sections in the chapter. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. This includes Medicare-eligible veterans not covered under section 1710(a)(1) of the title, under terms similar to payments made to other managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. Medicare-eligible veterans not covered under section 1710(a)(1) of the title are included, under terms similar to payments made to other managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Certified Medicare Choice organizations under section 1857 of the Social Security Act are deemed to include Department managed health care plans that conform to prescribed standards. The Secretary certifies a list of qualifying plans annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The term 'Medicare Choice organization' refers to a managed health care organization under part C of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, added by subsection (b), applies to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
